title: [BUG] ERROR: Couldn't install package: sktime
body:
**Describe the bug**
sktime cannot be installed.

`python setup.py egg_info `does not run successfully. There are multiple top-level packages discovered in a flat-layout: ['sktime', 'build_tools', 'extension_templates']


**To Reproduce**
Attempt an install of sktime

```
$ pipenv install sktime
```

```shell
$ pipenv install sktime                                                                                                                                                           [45/324]
Installing sktime...                                                                                                                                                                           
Adding sktime to Pipfile's [packages]...                                                                                                                                                       
✔ Installation Succeeded                                                                                                                                                                       
Installing dependencies from Pipfile.lock (ad0018)...                                                                                                                                          
  🐍   ▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉ 2/2 — 00:00:00                          
An error occurred while installing sktime==0.8.0 --hash=sha256:dc17e38eeb5d00361b42386c781ed56441134f859c120a4e4b1b030f87ae00d8 --hash=sha256:c0c99eebfccdd8ec603ecfc61aac4d9dca3e1d307b82920de
2a5bcd3cf8453b4 --hash=sha256:396216ea7fb63c5c611c38f140212a9d4976608bd55f8bbccd78ba5df7e70727 --hash=sha256:60f066de8a54318f29a5fb9b19ca8e73d67c69529c0fb318cfae9357a6c21247 --hash=sha256:657
0ad33794dbb49ec78f891e51195d48b45091d2776072def4c995e0e3b5603 --hash=sha256:9f5418f1c1d1d7b0d32ba03890d9ed67f7416be17cb575894bbf6faca6d09af1 --hash=sha256:764dc1254b75e4f42907320eb67e75d734e9
73704f70bf508748cbeb59ba6b14 --hash=sha256:2df1185e045c9927e0deaa7ec7e6e56012df999ce9e382162a12f39d569a020e --hash=sha256:8970f2d4f2eb54c0181b05f5714d198a0fa95c127252475e5216a702347cd881 --ha
sh=sha256:8c7e27ea93bfcbf90b0d813ed5ec992649624936af2853045eb0bffc0eb5522f --hash=sha256:bb9c97b9f77f140ccf495f412068e842193091e9ac0122e21aca709c02325e3d --hash=sha256:f35ab884a456ce7eea61d0b
d20527cf389ab7b1ae7c04ebad9b9025b8fee02ae --hash=sha256:6debacac87cf4ce6a89691c16e8a93c6dd22bfe42ef9156bf1869f2bc84acc4e --hash=sha256:91fad9b80eb5d986226265594961a8198f67cf05e2a7e75f2e790458
cef400ef --hash=sha256:15a629df60f7512c37e5f7391e19039a3bcf75fd6dc96ec6b158ff453fa7ca0d --hash=sha256:25ad30cd6c6167ddb9dee90114df7ecb8b4518a9df9e2eaa83580c79930ac037! Will try again.
Installing initially failed dependencies...
[pipenv.exceptions.InstallError]: Collecting sktime==0.8.0                                                                                                                                     
[pipenv.exceptions.InstallError]:   Using cached sktime-0.8.0.tar.gz (9.7 MB)
[pipenv.exceptions.InstallError]:   Preparing metadata (setup.py): started                                                                                                                     
[pipenv.exceptions.InstallError]:   Preparing metadata (setup.py): finished with status 'error' 
[pipenv.exceptions.InstallError]: error: subprocess-exited-with-error                                                                                                                          
[pipenv.exceptions.InstallError]:   
[pipenv.exceptions.InstallError]:   × python setup.py egg_info did not run successfully.                                                                                                       
[pipenv.exceptions.InstallError]:   │ exit code: 1   
[pipenv.exceptions.InstallError]:   ╰─> [16 lines of output]                                                                                                                                   
[pipenv.exceptions.InstallError]:       /home/user/.local/share/virtualenvs/pdva-VEwz2__Q/lib/python3.10/site-packages/setuptools/dist.py:771: UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'descrip
tion-file' will not be supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name 'description_file' instead                                                 
[pipenv.exceptions.InstallError]:         warnings.warn(
[pipenv.exceptions.InstallError]:       error: Multiple top-level packages discovered in a flat-layout: ['sktime', 'build_tools', 'extension_templates'].
[pipenv.exceptions.InstallError]:            
[pipenv.exceptions.InstallError]:       To avoid accidental inclusion of unwanted files or directories,                                 
[pipenv.exceptions.InstallError]:       setuptools will not proceed with this build.
[pipenv.exceptions.InstallError]:                                                                                                                                                              
[pipenv.exceptions.InstallError]:       If you are trying to create a single distribution with multiple packages
[pipenv.exceptions.InstallError]:       on purpose, you should not rely on automatic discovery.                                             
[pipenv.exceptions.InstallError]:       Instead, consider the following options:
[pipenv.exceptions.InstallError]:                                                                                                                                                              
[pipenv.exceptions.InstallError]:       1. set up custom discovery (`find` directive with `include` or `exclude`)
[pipenv.exceptions.InstallError]:       2. use a `src-layout`
[pipenv.exceptions.InstallError]:       3. explicitly set `py_modules` or `packages` with a list of names
[pipenv.exceptions.InstallError]:           
[pipenv.exceptions.InstallError]:       To find more information, look for "package discovery" on setuptools docs.
[pipenv.exceptions.InstallError]:       [end of output]                    
[pipenv.exceptions.InstallError]:   
[pipenv.exceptions.InstallError]:   note: This error originates from a subprocess, and is likely not a problem with pip.
[pipenv.exceptions.InstallError]: error: metadata-generation-failed
[pipenv.exceptions.InstallError]: 
[pipenv.exceptions.InstallError]: × Encountered error while generating package metadata.
[pipenv.exceptions.InstallError]: ╰─> See above for output.
[pipenv.exceptions.InstallError]: 
[pipenv.exceptions.InstallError]: note: This is an issue with the package mentioned above, not pip.
[pipenv.exceptions.InstallError]: hint: See above for details.
ERROR: Couldn't install package: sktime

```

**Expected behavior**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
-->
It is expected that sktime installs without issue.

**Additional context**
<!--
Add any other context about the problem here.
-->

This might be relevant:
[https://github.com/nucleic/kiwi/issues/130](https://github.com/nucleic/kiwi/issues/130)


**Versions**
$ uname -a 
Linux localhost 4.18.0-25-generic #26~18.04.1-Ubuntu SMP Thu Jun 27 07:28:31 UTC 2019 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
(pdva) localhost$ python -V
Python 3.10.0
$ pipenv --version
pipenv, version 2022.4.20


<!--
Please run the following code snippet and paste the output here:
 
from sktime import show_versions; show_versions()
-->

</details>

<!-- Thanks for contributing! -->
